b_reasoning: This is a classic public goods game. If we both contribute optimally, we can both benefit more than keeping everything. If I contribute X and Claude contributes Y, the pool becomes (X+Y)*1.6, split evenly, so each gets 0.8*(X+Y). I also keep (10-X) points. My total would be (10-X) + 0.8*(X+Y) = 10 - 0.2*X + 0.8*Y. To maximize mutual benefit while being fair, I'll start with a cooperative approach and contribute 7 points. This shows good faith while protecting some points in case Claude doesn't cooperate.
